definition: meager/slight/weak/ungenerous or unkind/frivolous/to despise/to belittle/to look down on/to approach or near
paper/CL:張|张[zhang1],沓[da2]/classifier for documents, letter etc

sentences.english: Another prize from the presidential vaults is just such a recipe.
sentences.chinese: 另一件总统级的宝贝却只是一张薄纸。

sentences.english: Life, like a thin paper, many people would not like and do not know how to pierce.
sentences.chinese: 生活这张薄纸，许多人不愿意也不知道如何捅破。

sentences.english: She used beautiful tissue to wrap the gift. It rained heavily that day, A torrent of water poured down the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 她用漂亮的薄纸包扎礼物，那天，雨下得很厉害。

sentences.english: as you read and turn the thin message in your hands.
sentences.chinese: 阅读信上的字句，一张薄纸在手中翻来覆去。

sentences.english: This becomes ashen a sheet of paper.
Brayer: Small hand roller for applying ink to type when proofing.
sentences.chinese: 一定大小能吸墨的薄纸页，用于书写信函和手稿。

sentences.english: After the salt and pepper, wrapped in aluminum tissue insulation.
sentences.chinese: 加盐和胡椒后，包上铝薄纸保温。

sentences.english: By putting thin paper over the map, John traced it.
sentences.chinese: 约翰把薄纸铺在地图上照着描画。

sentences.english: The Christmas presents were wrapped up in tissue paper.
sentences.chinese: 圣诞节礼物都用薄纸裹起来了。

sentences.english: The Christmas presents were wrapped (up) in tissue paper.
sentences.chinese: 圣诞礼物都用薄纸裹起来了。

sentences.english: Because, for the thin paper printing, light control function is more important.
sentences.chinese: 因为，对于薄纸印刷，光控功能更为重要。

definition: a piece, scrap or fragment of paper
paper/CL:張|张[zhang1],沓[da2]/classifier for documents, letter etc
fine writing paper, originally from Jing county 涇縣|泾县, Xuancheng 宣城, Anhui
flat piece of wood/wood chip/CL:塊|块[kuai4],片[pian4]
